questions.question: A 5 kg box is lifted 2 meters vertically. What is the work done against gravity? (g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: Work = Fd = (mg)d = (5 kg × 10 m/s²) × 2 m = 50 N × 2 m = 100 J

questions.question: A 800 kg car travels at 20 m/s. What is its kinetic energy?
A 60 kg person climbs 3 meters up a ladder. What is their gain in gravitational potential energy? (g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: PE = mgh = 60 kg × 10 m/s² × 3 m = 1,800 J

questions.question: A force of 50 N pushes a box 8 meters across a floor. How much work is done?
A 0.5 kg ball is thrown with a speed of 10 m/s. What is its kinetic energy?
A 2,000 kg elevator rises 15 meters. What is its increase in potential energy? (g = 10 m/s²)
A rollercoaster car (500 kg) is at the top of a 40 meter hill. What is its potential energy? (g = 10 m/s²)
The same rollercoaster car (500 kg) reaches the bottom of the 40 m hill. Assuming no energy loss, what is its speed at the bottom? (g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: All PE converts to KE: mgh = ½mv² → v = √(2gh) = √(2 × 10 × 40) = √800 = 28.3 m/s

questions.question: A 1,200 kg rollercoaster car has 150,000 J of kinetic energy. What is its speed?
A rollercoaster car (800 kg) is moving at 15 m/s. What is its kinetic energy?
A 300 kg rollercoaster car starts from rest at 50 m height. What is its total mechanical energy? (g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: At top: PE = mgh = 300 × 10 × 50 = 150,000 J, KE = 0. Total energy = 150,000 J

questions.question: A rollercoaster car has 80,000 J of energy at 30 m height. What is its mass? (g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: At top, all energy is PE: PE = mgh → 80,000 = m × 10 × 30 → m = 80,000/300 = 266.7 kg

questions.question: A force does 2,500 J of work moving an object 25 meters. What is the force?
A 4 kg object gains 200 J of kinetic energy. By how much did its speed increase if it started from rest?
A rollercoaster car loses 45,000 J of potential energy as it descends. If its mass is 300 kg, how far did it drop? (g = 10 m/s²)
A 600 kg rollercoaster car is at 20 m height with 24,000 J of kinetic energy. What is its total energy? (g = 10 m/s²)
How much work is done lifting a 25 kg weight 1.2 meters? (g = 10 m/s²)
A rollercoaster car (400 kg) needs 64,000 J of kinetic energy for a loop. What speed must it have?
A box is pushed with a constant 80 N force for 5 meters. How much work is done?
A rollercoaster design requires cars to have 180,000 J of energy at the start. If cars are 600 kg, from what height should they start? (g = 10 m/s²)

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered energy and work calculations!
scoreMessages.70: Good work! Practice the formulas: W = Fd, KE = ½mv², PE = mgh
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing! Remember to use g = 10 m/s² and check your units.
scoreMessages.0: Review the basic energy formulas and try the calculations again.
